channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Queensland Women's Week
item.description:
Sunday, 2 March 2025

Story Bridge will be lit Purple to support Queensland Women's Week

Queensland Women's Week was established in 2016 to expand the annual International Women's Day celebration into a statewide series of events and activities to celebrate and recognise the achievements and success of women and girls and promote gender equality across Queensland.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Government, Office For Women

item.title: Maddie's Vision
item.description:
Monday, 3 March 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to support Maddie's Vision

The purpose of this national event is to raise awareness around Bone Marrow Failure Syndrome. To find better support options, treatments and a cure for patients living with Bone Marrow Failure Syndrome and their families.

This Light Up is organised by: Maddie Riewoldts Vision

item.title: Shine a Light on Lymphoedema
item.description:
Wednesday, 5 March 2025

City Hall will be lit Blue to support Shine a Light on Lymphoedema

‘Shine A Light On Lymphoedema’ sees over 100 Landmarks around Australia lit up in blue, to help raise much needed and funds, and to support Australians living with lymphoedema. The Lymphoedema Association Australia (LAA) has a vision for a world in which people who live with lymphoedema are always met with understanding by the community and the health system. Our goals include awareness, education, support and advocacy.

This Light Up is organised by: Lymphoedema Australia

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Shine Like a Sunflower
item.description:
Thursday, 6 March 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Yellow to support Shine Like a Sunflower

The "Shine Like a Sunflower" campaign illuminates Australia in a vibrant yellow glow, symbolising hope, awareness, and the urgent need for funding and support for scleroderma. By lighting up iconic landmarks, trees and businesses across the country, we aim to: Increase Awareness: Scleroderma is often misdiagnosed and misunderstood. "Shine Like a Sunflower" brings this hidden disease into the spotlight, educating the public about its impact and the challenges faced by those living with it. Unlike other conditions, scleroderma often lacks dedicated nursing support. Your Sunflower Day donation helps us change that by funding specialist nurses who provide essential care and guidance to those in need.

This Light Up is organsied by: Scleroderma Australia

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Red Bow Month, celebrating Red Bow Day
item.description:
Friday, 7 March 2025

City Hall will be lit Red to support Red Bow Month, celebrating Red Bow Day

Red Bow Month is observed state-wide throughout March to increase community awareness of muscular dystrophy. Red Bow Day is the first Friday of the month (7 March 2025) and is the biggest awareness and fundraiser day for Muscular Dystrophy Queensland (MDQ). MDQ provides services and support for people with muscular dystrophy and other neuromuscular conditions, as well as their families and carers.

This Light Up is organised by: Muscular Dystrophy Queensland

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

Red Bow Day is the first Friday of the month (7 March 2025) and is the biggest awareness and fundraiser day for Muscular Dystrophy Queensland (MDQ). MDQ provides services and support for people with muscular dystrophy and other neuromuscular conditions, as well as their families and carers.

This Light Up is organised by: Muscular Dystrophy Queensland

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: International Women's Day
item.description:
Saturday, 8 March 2025

City Hall will be lit Purple to support International Women's Day

International Women's Day is celebrated on the 8th March, as part of Queensland Women's Week. Queensland Women's Week (QWW) recognises and celebrates the successes and achievements of women and girls across Queensland. It's a time to acknowledge that everyone has a role to play in creating a Queensland community that respects women, embraces gender equality, and promotes and protects the rights, interests and wellbeing of women and girls. By doing this, we enrich and strengthen our communities and create a more equal Queensland where everyone is valued.

This Light Up is organised by: Queensland Government, Office For Women

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: International Women's Day Fun Run
item.description:
Sunday, 9 March 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Pink to support International Women's Day Fun Run

International Women's Day Fun Run presented by Queensland X-Ray raises awareness and funds to support women with breast cancer, to help Mater clinicians and researchers achieve this.

This Light Up is organised by: The Trustee for Mater Foundation

item.title: Endometriosis Awareness Month
item.description:
Monday, 10 March 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support Endometriosis Awareness Month

Endometriosis is a chronic disease affecting 1 in 7 women and those presumed female at birth by the age of 49 impacting approximately 200 million people worldwide and
nearly 1 million in Australia. While about 50% of the population has heard of endometriosis, awareness remains surface-level, with many unaware of its profound impact on daily life and long-term health. By illuminating landmarks across towns and cities, we strive to amplify our message nationally to drive deeper understanding and greater awareness of this often-overlooked condition

This Light Up is organised by: Endometriosis Australia Ltd

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Squash Australian Open
item.description:
Tuesday, 11 March – Wednesday, 12 March 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Green and Gold to support the Squash Australian Open

The Squash Australian Open is a Professional Squash Association (PSA) World Tour Gold Event that brings together the world's top squash players to compete for the title of Australian Open Champion. Hosted in Brisbane in 2025, this exciting tournament showcases high-level squash action as elite athletes battle for glory on one of the sport's biggest stages. With a festival around the precinct including kid’s activations, food, and beverage options the event will cater to all sport fans. Don’t miss your opportunity to be a part of this unforgettable week of Squash!

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: World Kidney Day
item.description:
Thursday, 13 March 2025

City Hall will be lit Red to support World Kidney Day

World Kidney Day is 13th March, 2025? yes, yet ‘another world day’? BUT kidney disease is one of the least known diseases despite 3 in 4 Aussies being at risk. Given that 1.8 million Australians have kidney disease and don’t know about it, raising awareness is therefore vital to ensure everyone talks to their GP about their Kidney Health.

This Light Up is organised by: Kidney Health Australia

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

World Kidney Day is 13th March, 2025? yes, yet ‘another world day’? BUT kidney disease is one of the least known diseases despite 3 in 4 Aussies being at risk. Given that 1.8 million Australians have kidney disease and don’t know about it, raising awareness is therefore vital to ensure everyone talks to their GP about their Kidney Health.

This Light Up is organised by: Kidney Health Australia

Light up asset: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Endometriosis Awareness Month
item.description:
Friday, 14 March 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support Endometriosis Awareness Month

Endometriosis is a chronic disease affecting 1 in 7 women and those presumed female at birth by the age of 49 impacting approximately 200 million people worldwide and
nearly 1 million in Australia. While about 50% of the population has heard of endometriosis, awareness remains surface-level, with many unaware of its profound impact on daily life and long-term health. By illuminating landmarks across towns and cities, we strive to amplify our message nationally to drive deeper understanding and greater awareness of this often-overlooked condition

This Light Up is organised by: Endometriosis Australia Ltd

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.description:
Saturday, 15 March 2025

City Hall will be lit Red to support 20th Anniversary of Dance for Daniel

item.title: St Patrick's Day Parade and Brisbane Irish Festival
item.description:
Saturday, 15 March – Sunday, 16 March 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Green to celebrate the St Patrick's Day Parade and Brisbane Irish Festival

The Brisbane Irish Festival is a long-standing annual event that promotes and celebrates the occasion of St Patrick’s Day, Irish culture and its contribution to the state of Queensland. This year the festival runs from the 2nd to the 17th of March with events, concerts and gatherings. Come and join us as we paint the town green again on Saturday 15th March 2025 for the St Patrick’s Day Parade.

This Light Up is organised by: St Patrick's Day Parade Association Incorporated

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: St Patrick's Day
item.description:
Monday, 17 March 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Green to celebrate the St Patrick's Day

The Brisbane Irish Festival is a long-standing annual event that promotes and celebrates the occasion of St Patrick’s Day, Irish culture and its contribution to the state of Queensland. The St Patrick’s Day Parade has been held amidst the streets of Brisbane city since 1989, flooding the inner-city district with a colourful convoy of more than 80 floats and displays representing Irish culture that provide free community-oriented entertainment for all ages.

This Light Up is organised by: St Patrick's Day Parade Association Incorporated

item.title: French Film Festival
item.description:
Tuesday, 18 March 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to celebrate the French Film Festival

The Alliance Francaise French Film Festival will be presenting its 36th edition this year, with the purpose of showcasing the best of French Cinema. It aims to enrich the cultural landscape by fostering cross-cultural exchange and understanding, attracting diverse audiences, supporting the local arts scene, and strengthening Brisbane’s reputation as a vibrant, multicultural city.

This Light Up is organised by: Alliance Francaise de Brisbane

item.title: Brisbane Cycling Festival
item.description:
Thursday, 20 March 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit All Colours to celebrate the Brisbane Cycling Festival

The Brisbane Cycling Festival returns for a massive and exciting sixth edition in 2025 from Friday, March 21 to Sunday, April 13.
Get ready for an epic celebration of cycling, with over 100 events and activities for all ages and abilities, both on and off the bike, including the Active Lifestyle expo and Tour de Brisbane. Stay tuned for the full program of events at brisbanecyclingfestival.com

item.title: Hamony Day
item.description:
Friday, 21 March 2025

City Hall will be lit Orange to celebrate Harmony Day

Harmony Day is celebrated annually on 21 March in Australia. Harmony Day began in 1999, coinciding with the United Nations International Day for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination. The message of Harmony Day is social cohesion and racial harmony, and it is expressed through community participation, inclusiveness, celebrating diversity, respect and
belonging.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Home Affairs

item.title: World Science Festival
item.description:
Saturday, 22 March 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to celebrate the World Science Festival

The World Science Festival will be back in Brisbane from 21 - 30 March 2025, with brave new ideas and mind-bending exhibits. The only global extension of this hugely popular initiative, World Science Festival Brisbane celebrates the entanglement of science and art through a curated program of thought-provoking conversations, inspiring theatrical and cinematic experiences, interactive workshops and engaging demonstrations.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: World TB Day
item.description:
Monday, 24 March 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support World TB Day

World TB Day and the Light Up Red campaign raise awareness for Tuberculosis, the 'silent pandemic'. Every year, 10 million people fall ill with TB. Despite being a preventable and curable disease, 1.5 million people die from TB each year, making it the world’s top infectious killer.

This Light Up is organised by: Results Australia

item.title: Make March Purple
item.description:
Tuesday, 25 March – Wednesday, 26 March 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support Make March Purple

Make March Purple is an Australia wide campaign supported by epilepsy organisations across the country and the national peak body, Epilepsy Australia. Make March Purple for epilepsy campaign helps create a community that is aware of epilepsy, breaking down barriers for people living with the condition. World Purple Day, held on March 26 is an international day of awareness in support of 50 million people living with epilepsy. myimpact.epilepsyqueensland.com.au…

This Light Up is organised by: Epilepsy Queensland

Make March Purple for epilepsy campaign helps create a community that is aware of epilepsy, breaking down barriers for people living with the condition. World Purple Day, held on March 26 is an international day of awareness in support of 50 million people living with epilepsy. https://myimpact.epilepsyqueensland.com.au/make-march-purple
This Light Up is organised by: Epilepsy Queensland

item.description:
Wednesday, 26 March 2025

City Hall will be lit Green with Red to support Bangladesh Independence Day

The 26 March is Bangladesh Independence Day and an important day for all Bangladeshi community members in Queensland as they celebrate the birth of the new nation formed in 1971.

This Light Up is organised by: The Bangladesh Association in Brisbane Incorporated

item.title: Brisbane Cycling Festival
item.description:
Friday, 28 March 2025

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit All Colours to celebrate the Brisbane Cycling Festival

The Brisbane Cycling Festival returns for a massive and exciting sixth edition in 2025 from Friday, March 21 to Sunday, April 13.
Get ready for an epic celebration of cycling, with over 100 events and activities for all ages and abilities, both on and off the bike, including the Active Lifestyle expo and Tour de Brisbane. Stay tuned for the full program of events at brisbanecyclingfestival.com

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Run Army
item.description:
Saturday, 29 March 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Red and White to support Run Army

Run Army’s mission is to promotes health, fitness and wellbeing through running support programs and a nation‐wide event; to fulfil our commitment to the wellbeing of our people and the community. We have now moved into a new era, joining forces with Queensland’s Police, Fire and Ambulance services to create one super‐sized community event. Our combined efforts will unite all those who serve the community in uniform as we collectively strive for health and wellbeing and care for our veterans and their families.
The event is open to anyone who can walk or run at least 5km and you can participate at the physical events in Brisbane and Townsville or the virtual event anywhere in Australia or the world! Why not come and join us?

This Light Up is organised by: NX Sports Community Foundation Limited

Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Epic Walk for DV
item.description:
Sunday, 30 March 2025

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to support Epic Walk for DV

Join the Epic Walk for DV on Sunday 30 March 2025. Take a stand against domestic violence and help us create a sea of purple at New Farm Park in support of Women's Legal Service Qld. The funds raised as part of the Epic Walk for DV 2025 goes to Women's Legal Service Qld (WLSQ) to help WLSQ to answer more calls to their Statewide Helpline, provide more free legal appointments and reach more women when they need it most.

This Light Up is organised by: Women's Legal Service

item.title: Trans Day of Visibility
item.description:
Monday, 31 March 2025

Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue, White and Pink to celebrate the Trans Day of Visibility

Trans Day of Visibility (TDOV) is an annual international celebration of trans pride and awareness, that is dedicated to celebrating Transgender and Gender Diverse communities and raising awareness of the stigma and discrimination faced. In addition to this, the purpose of the day is also to celebrate our communities by being visible and proud.

This Light Up is organised by: Many Genders One Voice/ Qld Aids Council

Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset
